result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
8:43 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing. Defendant Jeffery M Schwartz in court.  Attorney Thomas J. Schneck in court for Jeffery M Schwartz.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Schneck provides an update; he notes his client just had a new case filed and has one more Domestic Abuse class to complete.  Atty. Schneck needs time to get a new global resolution with the State and is requesting a further proceedings date in about 45-60 days.  No objection by the State.  Court raises concerns about the defendant complying with court orders, specifically as it relates to alcohol consumption.  Atty. Schneck responds.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 030857,
Payable Number: 471630,
Receipt Number: 22R 033289,
Amount: $20.00
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:30 AM; Case called for Hearing.   Defendant Jeffery M Schwartz in court with attorney Thomas J. Schneck.  Alyssa M Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Schneck provieds an update, his client is still in DV counseling and wants to wait for completion.  Atty. Schneck is requesting a new plea and sentencing date in late October.  No objection fro the State.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Jeffery M Schwartz

Prior: W243 N6601 W Haven Dr., Sussex, WI 53089
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

Apply cash bail previously posted and refund balance to the poster.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

09:51 AM Defendant Jeffery M Schwartz in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Attorney Schneck respresents the defendant on his other matters.  The defendant will be in contact with Attorney Schneck to make him aware of this new case.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.
